notes: Bt cotton introduced; later HT and stacked traits approved.
Initial wave incl. MON810, Bt11, TC1507 (then many stacks).
First GM crop in Argentina (RR soybean).
Second-generation soybean with HT+IR traits.
First commercial GM canola approvals (RR & InVigor).
First GM cotton grown in Australia.
Commercial release of GM safflower for industrial oil.
Four BARI Bt brinjal varieties approved (limited release in 2013; planting began 2014).
First GM cotton approved (Bt event 531).
First GM eucalyptus approved worldwide.
First GM maize approvals (including MON810, Bt11).
First GM crop approved in Brazil (Roundup Ready soybean).
Second-generation soybean with herbicide tolerance + insect resistance.
First GM sugarcane approved in Brazil (sugarcane borer resistance).
HT alfalfa approved.
Arctic apple approved.
First GM crop approved in Canada.
Bt and HT maize approved.
Innate potato approved.
Roundup Ready soybean approved.
HT sugar beet approved.
Safety certificates granted; no commercial planting yet.
Biosafety certificates granted but no commercial planting.
Cultivation of GM crops banned by 2012 decree; imports of GM foods/feeds continue.
First GE crop commercialized in Ethiopia.
First GM canola imports approved.
First GM cotton imports approved.
Only GM crop authorised for cultivation in the EU; grown mainly in Spain and Portugal.
First GM soy imports approved; many events authorised since.
HT sugar beet imports authorised for feed/food use.
First and only GM crop commercially cultivated in India.
GEAC approved; subject to ongoing court cases.
Cabinet approved Bt cotton; commercial planting commenced 2020.
Government moved to enable GM maize; cases in court in 2023; process ongoing.
GM cotton cultivated in Mexico; approvals maintained across years.
Policy actions limiting/contesting GE corn use and cultivation (decrees, litigation, USMCA dispute).
No commercial GM crop cultivation as of 2025; reforms in progress to change framework.
First GM crop commercialized in Nigeria (two MAHYCO Bt cotton varieties).
Pod-borer-resistant cowpea (AAT709A) approved; first GM food crop in Nigeria.
Commercial release following earlier environmental release.
Bt cotton approvals introduced alongside soybean/maize portfolio.
Commercial approvals for GM maize noted in GAIN reporting.
High adoption of GM soybean after mid-2000s policy shifts.
DA-BPI biosafety permit for commercial propagation issued Oct 18, 2022.
Court of Appeals ordered cease and desist on commercial propagation.
First GE crop cultivated in the Philippines (corn).
DA-BPI commercial propagation permit issued July 2021.
Court of Appeals revoked the biosafety permit for commercial propagation (Apr 17, 2024).
First GM crop commercialized in South Africa.
First GE maize approved (see USDA 2019).
MON810 approved for commercial production under GMO Act framework.
Herbicide-tolerant soybean approved for cultivation.
Later re-approved 2011 after litigation.
Arctic apple approved.
First Bt cotton approved.
First GM maize events approved.
Virus-resistant papaya for Hawaii.
Innate potato approved.
First GM soybean approval (GTS 40-3-2).
Virus-resistant squash approved.
HT sugar beet widely grown.
Five GM maize events approved in 2011 (portfolio now larger).
GM soybean cultivated; approvals expanded over time.
MARD began exceptional recognition of GE corn hybrids for cultivation (2014–2016).
Approvals resumed; additional hybrids approved under Crop Production Law.
